intro: Soldanella × media, commonly known as the hybrid snowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Colchicaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that resemble those of true snowdrops. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
